About me

Hi there! My name is Harry and I'm a front end developer currently working remotely in the UK.

I've been obsessed with computers from a young age, some of my earliest memories involve tinkering with DAW software to produce electronic music, and creating logo's / graphics with photoshop for many of my long forgotten ambitions and projects. This connection between the technical and the creative has always interested me and building / creating things is what drives me as a person.

I was first introduced to code through MAX MSP, an audio programming tool used to create programmatic music / sound design as well as routing audio hardware. Through research I discovered that MAX was built with C++ using the JUCE platform, this piqued my curiosity. 30 hours of C++ tutorials later I had developed my first piece of software which was an EQ effect plugin.

There are a few things that naturally drew me to web / front end development. Most notably I love the accessibility of web applications from a user perspective, and the workflow between solving complex problems, handling data, and displaying it in beautiful interactive UI's. My skillset has matured enough to have started building and maintaining websites for real world clients, and I am now looking for full time opportunities in the industry.

I use a service called Wakatime to monitor how much time I spend coding.

This doesn't include any administrative work, research, design, learning resources.
